pros: Some nice people. Actually very few nice people. It is a good cause. I actually liked popping in and out of places and being on the go the whole day. For me it was a full fulling job.
cons:
Bad management. There were a few long time employees that were the source of company "witch hunts". Spreading false accusations. Very hurtful rumors when it came to job performance. For some reason, the paranoid management listened to these rumors instead of honest employees who worked hard with no mistakes. The management makes for a toxic and negative work environment. In hindsight, the blood delivery method is lax. They use store bought Igloo lunch coolers to deliver the blood units! A very insecure way of delivering the important blood for hospitals.

A better choice for donations would be Red Cross, or Heartland Blood Centers. Their system of hosptial delivery is more secure.

review_title: The company name has been run into the ground
pros: When I started, good 403b, PTO and health benefits. There are some nice people there, I am still in contact with even after leaving in 2012, having done a perfect job for three years.
cons: Health benefits were transferred to a watered down healthcare group, less benefits. The name of "Life Source" from what I am reading is being run into the ground. Better options for donation would be Red Cross and Heartland Blood Centers, in my humble opinion. I spent 3 years of my life there, and it seemed that the management did not respect you. I am glad to have moved on to a less negative company.
